result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dennis Jessie Stone

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dennis Jessie Stone in court with attorney Martin Russell Tanz.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for pretrial conference. Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing.

No contact with 2921 W Chambers St
No use of possession of controlled substances unless prescribed by a doctor.
No firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Dennis Jessie Stone
Current: 3324 N 24th Pl, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 01-13-2022)
Prior: 2921 West Chambers Street Lower, Milwaukee, WI 53210

At the request of the Court, matter set for bail hearing.  Court would like to review the conditions of bail.  Court ordered additional condition of:  No use of controlled substances unless prescribed by a doctor.  No possession of firearms.  No contact with 2921 W Chambers St.  Court ordered matter set for pretrial conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 17.

Defendant Dennis Jessie Stone in court with attorney Martin Russell Tanz.  
John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Bail/Bond Review on January 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

The Court ordered this matter scheduled for a Bail Violation Review Hearing in Br 17, Room 316 of the Safety Building.  Notices electronically sent.  mn  Bail/Bond Review scheduled for January 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Co-defendant.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.

Defendant Dennis Jessie Stone in court with attorney Paige Aleece Styler.  Defendant Dennis Jessie Stone in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dennis Jessie Stone appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
